If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

Bug Report
/kind bug

**What happened**: I created a PVC for a Managed Disk. The Pod which used the PVC fails to start:

```
Events:
  FirstSeen	LastSeen	Count	From				SubObjectPath	Type		Reason			Message
  ---------	--------	-----	----				-------------	--------	------			-------
  7m		7m		4	default-scheduler				Warning		FailedScheduling	persistentvolumeclaim "dd-managed-fast-01" not found (repeated 4 times)
  6m		6m		5	default-scheduler				Warning		FailedScheduling	PersistentVolumeClaim is not bound: "dd-managed-fast-01" (repeated 4 times)
  5m		5m		1	default-scheduler				Normal		Scheduled		Successfully assigned test-azure-disk-1874458390-rp5fh to colemick172-worker-2
  5m		5m		1	kubelet, colemick172-worker-2			Normal		SuccessfulMountVolume	MountVolume.SetUp succeeded for volume "default-token-kgmh6" 
  3m		49s		2	kubelet, colemick172-worker-2			Warning		FailedMount		Unable to mount volumes for pod "test-azure-disk-1874458390-rp5fh_default(fb1fadc8-7919-11e7-b53d-000d3a342e21)": timeout expired waiting for volumes to attach/mount for pod "default"/"test-azure-disk-1874458390-rp5fh". list of unattached/unmounted volumes=[azure-managed-disk01]
  3m		49s		2	kubelet, colemick172-worker-2			Warning		FailedSync		Error syncing pod
  4m		26s		10	kubelet, colemick172-worker-2			Warning		FailedMount		MountVolume.MountDevice failed for volume "pvc-fd6e4309-7919-11e7-b53d-000d3a342e21" : azureDisk - mountDevice:FormatAndMount failed with failed to mount the volume as "ext4", it already contains unknown data, probably partitions. Mount error: mount failed: exit status 32
Mounting command: mount
Mounting arguments: /dev/sda /var/lib/kubelet/plugins/kubernetes.io/azure-disk/mounts/m238985726 ext4 [defaults]
Output: mount: /dev/sda is already mounted or /var/lib/kubelet/plugins/kubernetes.io/azure-disk/mounts/m238985726 busy
```

**What you expected to happen**: The PV to mount, format and the Pod to start

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**: Boot a 1.7.2 or higher, apply this Gist: https://gist.github.com/colemickens/0cd6a12fdbf5a8b5040724a0b8e900fd

**Anything else we need to know?**: N/a

**Environment**: Azure
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 
`Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"7", GitVersion:"v1.7.2", GitCommit:"922a86cfcd65915a9b2f69f3f193b8907d741d9c", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-07-21T08:23:22Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}`
`Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"7", GitVersion:"v1.7.2+coreos.0", GitCommit:"c6574824e296e68a20d36f00e71fa01a81132b66", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-07-24T23:28:22Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}`
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: Azure
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): 
```
NAME="Container Linux by CoreOS"
ID=coreos
VERSION=1353.8.0
VERSION_ID=1353.8.0
BUILD_ID=2017-05-30-2322
PRETTY_NAME="Container Linux by CoreOS 1353.8.0 (Ladybug)"
ANSI_COLOR="38;5;75"
HOME_URL="https://coreos.com/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://issues.coreos.com"
```
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): `Linux colemick172-master-0 4.9.24-coreos #1 SMP Tue May 30 23:12:01 UTC 2017 x86_64 Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2673 v3 @ 2.40GHz GenuineIntel GNU/Linux`
- Install tools: `tectonic-installer`
